Here is the decision chaine that we use to collect a single page (Heritrix 
1.12.0):

1) REJECT by default (RejectDecideRule)
2) ACCEPT if Surt prefixed (SurtPrefixedDecideRule)
      seeds-as-surt-prefixes: true
      also-check-via: false
3) REJECT if too many hops (TooManyHopsDecideRule)
      max-hops: 0
4) ACCEPT if transcluded (TransclusionDecideRule)
      max-trans-hops: 1
      max-speculative-hops: 1
5) ACCEPT if prerequisite (PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule)

Rule 3) restricts the crawl to the given page (i.e. no HTML link will be 
followed). Rule 4) allows to collect all the embedded contents (images & 
co.). Rule 5) is necessary to fetch the robots.txt file of the remote 
site.

On Tue, 11 Mar 2008, 17:28, Micah Wedemeyer wrote:

> This might be no help, but based on my (very limited) experience, here's
> what I would look at:
>
> Set up your decision rules as follows:
>
> 1) REJECT all (RejectDecideRule)
> 2) ACCEPT by file pattern for what you want (js, jpeg, jpg) - try the
> ALL enumeration in MatchesFilePatternDecideRule, it will include lots of
> media stuff, but I don't know about javascript
> 3) ACCEPT by file pattern for anything not covered in step 2
> 4) ACCEPT seed - SeedAcceptDecideRule
>
> Hope this helps.
>
> Micah
